questions.answer_description:
✑ An office staff member tests emails, but the email is not sent.
✑ Mailboxes are set to synchronize with Microsoft Exchange in the Production instance.
We need to configure the QA environment as the synchronizing instance.
Implement Integration

choices.A: Add the QA environment as a synchronizing instance.
choices.B: Change the synchronization method in the QA environment.
choices.C: Add the QA environment as an OrgID in Exchange.
choices.D: Change the synchronizing instance of the QA environment.

questions.question_text:
You need to ensure that the office staff can successfully test emails.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Answer = D 
A mailbox can only be connected to 1 environment ( Sandbox / QA / Production. So if you had to change from Production to QA environment you must Test&Enable the mailbox in the QA environment.

I would say B... Change the Synchronization method of QA. You would change it to server side, and configure the mailboxes to be server side.
How would you even do D? 'Change the synchronizing instance' of QA?
Answer=B seems to the correct option. In Power platform admin centre, navigate to the QA environment -> Settings -> Email Settings and change the Synchronization methods.
It schould be A because "Testers only have access to the QA environment where testing occurs". So they have no production account.

comments.content: access to an environment doesnt mean that the mailbox is not configured to the production instance, even though not working.
I think we should Change not Add

discussion.content:
"We need to configure the QA environment as the synchronizing instance.
Implement Integration" So answer must be 'A' ??

comments.content: Agree totally, tester should RECEIVE the welcome email. We should set and sync the SENDER > D is correct

discussion.content:
In my opinion is D.
The text here does not describe the workflow, but we could assume that there is an email that will be sent from the "sender" mailbox ("welcome workflow" seems to me something automatic at some sort of registration). So that's it that has to be sync in QA (moreover you can sync a mail only with one environment, so it cannot be A).
It would be B if we thought that this workflow sends an email from the mailbox of the user (tester) that's triggering the workflow.
Correct Answer is : . Add the sender's email to synchronize to QA and Production.

comments.content: Agree with you, it should be A

correct answer is D.. remember case notes say that system settings are the same accross all 3 environments meaning that the workflow's From field will the sender account for all 3 environemnts.. not tester.. So to test the workflow, you would switch sender's mailbox to sync with QA

discussion.content:
The Tester is the one working in the test environment and supposedly should be able to SEND and RECEIVE, so this is a bit of distraction from the real point. You can only use Dynamics 365 Outlook App in ONE environment at the time. so the answer is B. Please refer to https://andz88.wordpress.com/2017/01/27/gotchas-on-dynamics-365-outlook-app-deployment/ 
Gotcha#1

question is that you need to test the workflow so in this case you are the tester so I guess it would be B. It could be sender if sender are testing the application or sender are sending email but someone else is testing that
The answer is B (I think) you should be using a separate account for testing and production sending. A mailbox is only setup to one instance
I would go with A. The sender is important to be able to send emails. tester email (recipient) can be whatever - gmail, 10 min email ..etc
what is the difference between option B and D ? tester's email and sender's email , what's the difference ? can anybody discuss please ?

comments.content: I believe the difference is you are testing in this case, so you are the tester, and the sender will most likely not be you.

choices.C: Add the tester's email to synchronize to QA and Production.
choices.A: Add the sender's email to synchronize to QA and Production.
choices.B: Switch the tester's email to synchronize only to QA.
choices.D: Switch the sender's email to synchronize only to QA.

questions.question_text:
You need to test the welcome email workflow.
What should you do?

comments.content:
but "Customizations must be made in the Sandbox environment, exported as a managed solution, and imported into the QA environment."
so that solution is as managed in QA and cannot be exported. he only updated label with unmanaged change.
I would go with export only primary from SB

I go with B also
I figured out that there's an issue in the field on the QA, I fixed the issue in Sandbox, then imported a "managed" solution to QA. I need to move the fix to Production, I export the same solution from Sandbox and import it to production, since you cannot export the managed solution from QA.
The text says that the solutions were imported as unmanaged into QA, so A is correct

Well all deployments have to go Sandbox -> QA -> Production
So regardless of what has made it to QA, you cant just export straight from Sandbox -> Production. Everthing thats been tested in QA should get deployed to Production.

yes, but the question says "You need to import all changes to production, including the change to the Number of Children label.", noy only the change to the number of children label. 
we can´t exported manager solution from QA. So, we have to export unmanager solution with the correction from Sandbox

discussion.content:
option A) Export only the primary solution from the QA environment.
coz the spelling mistake has already been corrected and imported from sandbox to QA environment by admin

I think the correct answer is C since we need to import ALL the customizations but the problem was fixed previously with some one unmanaged solution moved to QA environment. If we want to move it to a production instance we need to add this change to solution with other changes. 
All changes need to be moved from Sandbox to QA as managed. Managed solutions cannot be exported. B is also an option but C appeals to me. Any other opinions?
Answer C seems more logical since you want to make any changes in the sandbox, and import those changes to a solution to move it around, either as a managed or unmanaged solution.

comments.content: But the scenario states that the admin imported the changes to QA as an unmanaged solution, so it's fair to assume that isn't the case for this company. In that case I believe exporting the primary solution from the QA environment should capture the spelling fix along with everything else, so A is correct.

discussion.content: I vote for B (normally QA should be managed so impossible to export)

As usual, a confused question!
The right answer should be:
- Add the changes to the primary solution in Sandbox;
- Export the primary solution from Sandbox;
- Import primary solution in Production.
But we can choose only one option, so, "roll the dice" and choose one.
Likely the changes was done using the solution, this mean that changes are already inside it, so i vote for "B. Export only primary solution from the Sandbox environment" (and cross fingers).

questions.question_text:
You need to import all changes to production, including the change to the Number of Children label.
How should you import the changes?

choices.C: Add the change to the primary solution in the Sandbox environment.
choices.B: Export only the primary solution from the Sandbox environment.
choices.A: Export only the primary solution from the QA environment.
choices.D: Add the change to the primary solution in the QA environment.

questions.question_text:
You need to ensure that the nurse is able to retrieve patient records within the All Patients View screen.
Which view should you modify?

discussion.content: Seriously? Why not B? If we have incorrect filters on the view I'd go for changing the view filters not quick find...
maybe they mean - to make sure, that QuickFind View is active...

Could be...
But, if the "All Account" view was built applying a wrong filter (e.g. excluding Accounts without transactions in the last two year), so the problem could be inside it and not in the Quick Find.

comments.content: Good point. Although assuming Patient is the out of the box Contact entity which has 'All Contacts' view. You'd have to assume its the same view and hasn't been altered. Also that the nurse is searching using a searchable field...

discussion.content: Correct Answer
Yes, Quick find is the right option

questions.answer_description:
✑ A nurse uses the search on the All Patients view and cannot find a patient who left the clinic last year.
A view has a Quick Find box which will find all active records in the entity.

questions.question_text:
You need to update a guest's preferences in the guest form.
What should you use?

discussion.content:
D. Canvas App

Reasoning: Quick view form is non-editable. You can, however, embed a canvas app on the guest form. Then use contextual information from the form to update the related record data (i.e., guest preferences). 

Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/model-driven-apps/embed-canvas-app-in-form

comments.content: yeah but a bit of an overkill... why create a canvas app when you just need to record slipper size?...

discussion.content: option D Canvas App

Option D:
Existing canvas apps that use the sub-grid control will continue to work. However, we recommend that you migrate these apps to use a column instead. More information: Migrating embedded canvas apps on model-driven forms that use a list of rows related to the current (main form) row for details.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/model-driven-apps/embedded-canvas-app-guidelines

Data in quick view controls cannot be edited and quick view forms do not support form scripts.(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/create-edit-quick-view-forms)
Quick view forms are read-only. Use them to create forms that are for reading purposes only.
Answer should be D.

comments.content: i think it's C aswell.. the case says "The hotel wants to avoid custom development and Inline frames (Iframes) where possible." so canvas app wouldn't be an option

discussion.content:
I think the answer should be "C".
There is a comment in the last section that I think this is addressing: 
"During testing, a user discovered that on the guest record, there are two stay type fields: Stay Type, which is an option set, and Stay, which is a lookup. Stay does not appear in any other area."
The quickest way to fix this would be with a Quick View Form.
A canvas app is not tied to any data in the database, but quick view form could be placed on the form to substitute the two Stay Type fields.
Quick View are editable, but you can only add new single column sections.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/create-edit-quick-view-forms

D. Canvas App
Quick View Form isn't editable!
Data in a Quick View Form cannot be edited. Unsure on what the correct answer would be here.
